component.name: Stats
component.description: StatCard displays a single key metric with optional icon, trend badge, comparison text, and footer action; StatsGrid arranges multiple StatCards in a responsive grid.

useCases: Dashboard KPI cards showing revenue, users, or conversion rates
Summary metrics at the top of a report or analytics page
Single stat highlight with a trend indicator and comparison period
Metric overview grid that adapts to different surface levels

commonPatterns.name: default-stat-with-trend
commonPatterns.description: A standard stat card with an upward trend badge and period comparison.
commonPatterns.composition: <StatCard label="Revenue" value="$12,400" trend={{ value: "+12.5%", direction: "up" }} comparison="vs. last month" />

commonPatterns.name: large-variant-with-icon
commonPatterns.description: Large layout emphasizing the metric with an icon and secondary text.
commonPatterns.composition: } label="Total Revenue" value="$48,200" description="Year to date" secondary={+8% from last year} />

commonPatterns.name: stats-grid
commonPatterns.description: A responsive grid of stat cards automatically inheriting surface level.
commonPatterns.composition: <StatsGrid surfaceLevel={0}><StatCard label="Users" value="3,241" trend={{ value: "+5.2%", direction: "up" }} /><StatCard label="Bounce Rate" value="42%" trend={{ value: "+2.1%", direction: "down" }} /><StatCard label="Sessions" value="12,847" /><StatCard label="Conversion" value="3.6%" /></StatsGrid>

commonPatterns.name: stat-with-action
commonPatterns.description: Stat card with a footer action button.
commonPatterns.composition: <StatCard label="Open Issues" value="24" action={{ label: "View all", onClick: handleViewAll }} />

antiPatterns.reason: More than 4-6 stats in a single grid overwhelms the viewer and dilutes focus.
antiPatterns.alternative: Group related stats into separate StatsGrid sections with headings, or use MetricPanel for expandable detail.

antiPatterns.reason: StatCard is a display component, not a link or button. Using it for primary navigation creates confusing interaction patterns.
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Card with explicit Button or Link elements for navigational surfaces.

semanticMeaning.default: Compact card with value and trend on the same line; comparison and action in a footer row
semanticMeaning.large: Stacked layout with label/description on top, large value below; action centered in footer

slots.icon: Optional ReactNode rendered top-right of the card (both variants)
slots.label: Primary metric label text
slots.description: Muted helper text under the label
slots.secondary: ReactNode below the value (large variant); used for explainer text
slots.trend: Object with value string and direction ('up' | 'down'); renders a Badge (default variant)
slots.comparison: ReactNode in the footer left (default variant); typically period comparison text
slots.action: Object with label and optional onClick; renders a ghost Button in the footer

parentConstraints: surfaceLevel (0 | 1 | 2) controls the card's background and elevation; StatsGrid propagates surfaceLevel to children automatically

states: static display (no interactive states beyond optional action button)

interactions.action-click: Optional footer button triggers the action.onClick callback
interactions.surface-adaptation: surfaceLevel prop adjusts background (bg-card vs bg-secondary) and elevation (shadow vs none) automatically

accessibility.role: Presentational container; trend direction conveyed via Badge variant semantics (success/destructive)
accessibility.keyboardSupport: Footer action button is focusable and activatable via Enter/Space
accessibility.screenReader: Label, value, trend value, and comparison text are all readable in DOM order; icons should carry aria-label if meaningful
accessibility.focusManagement: No special focus management; standard tab order

rules: Always provide label and value props
Use surfaceLevel to match the parent surface: 0 for page background, 1 for inside a Card, 2 for nested surfaces
trend is only available in the default variant; the large variant uses secondary for supplementary info
valueSize controls only the metric text size (sm | md | lg); size controls overall card density
StatsGrid children that already set surfaceLevel will not be overridden
alternatives: MetricPanel for stat rows that expand to show detailed content
Card with custom layout for metrics that need richer formatting
Badge standalone for inline trend indicators without a card wrapper

aiHints.context: Use StatCard for individual key metrics on dashboards and summary sections. Use StatsGrid to lay out multiple StatCards in a responsive grid. The surfaceLevel system ensures correct visual hierarchy when StatCards are nested inside other surfaces.
